front.title: What is the difference between Probability and Likelihood?

back.desc: During the training phase, given some data, we determine the parameters of our model such that our model performance is maximized.
bullets: Likelihood : During the training phase, given some outcome, we determine theta that maximizes the probability that such an outcome occurs.
Probability : During the testing phase given a theta, we determine the probability of observing the outcome.

front.title: What is the Bayes theorem? How it is useful in a machine learning context?

back.desc: Bayes theorem allows us to determine posterior probabilities from our priors when presented with evidence. More simply, it is a method of revising existing predictions given new evidence.
bullets: How much more likely A is than B now, equals to how much more likely A was than B before we saw new evidence
Times how much more likely this evidence would be to occur if A were true than if B were true.
